text: First, train in the preliminaries.
Maintain an awareness of the preciousness of human life.
Be aware of the reality that life ends; death comes for everyone; Impermanence.
Recall that whatever you do, whether virtuous or not, has a result; Karma.
Contemplate that as long as you are too focused on self-importance and too caught up in thinking about how you are good or bad, you will experience suffering; Ego.
Regard all dharmas (phenomena) as dreams.
Examine the nature of unborn awareness.
Self-liberate even the antidote.
Rest in the nature of alaya, the essence.
In post-meditation, be a child of illusion.
Sending and taking should be practiced alternately. These two should ride the breath (Tonglen).
Three objects, three poisons, and three seeds of virtue.
In all activities, train with slogans.
Begin the sequence of exchange with yourself.

category: Transforming Adversity into the Path of Awakening
text: When the world is filled with evil, transform all mishaps into the path of bodhi (enlightenment).

category: Transforming Adversity into the Path of Awakening
text: Drive all blames into one (oneself).

category: Transforming Adversity into the Path of Awakening
text: Be grateful to everyone (Meditate on the great kindness of everyone).

category: Transforming Adversity into the Path of Awakening
text: Regarding confusion as the four kāyas is the unsurpassable śūnyatā (emptiness) protection.

category: Transforming Adversity into the Path of Awakening
text: The fourfold practice is the best of methods.

category: Transforming Adversity into the Path of Awakening
text: Whatever you meet unexpectedly, join with meditation.

category: Applying the Practice Throughout the Whole of Life
text: The essence of the instruction, briefly stated, is to apply yourself to the five strengths.

category: Applying the Practice Throughout the Whole of Life
text: The mahāyāna advice for transference (at death) involves the same five strengths.

category: Applying the Practice Throughout the Whole of Life
text: Conduct is important.

category: The Measure of Proficiency in Mind Training
text: All Dharma agrees at one point.

category: The Measure of Proficiency in Mind Training
text: Of the two witnesses, hold the principal one (the principal witness is you).

category: The Measure of Proficiency in Mind Training
text: Always maintain only a joyful mind.

category: The Measure of Proficiency in Mind Training
text: If you can practice even when distracted, you are well trained (or: proficient).
Always abide by the three basic principles (dedication, non-outrageous conduct, patience).
Change your attitude, but remain natural.
Don't talk about injured limbs (others' defects).
Don't ponder others' flaws.
Work with the greatest defilements (obstacles) first.
Abandon any hope of fruition (results).
Abandon poisonous food (cultivating superiority/ego).
Don't be so predictable (Don't hold grudges).
Don't malign others.
Don't wait in ambush.
Don't bring things to a painful point (Don't humiliate others).
Don't transfer the ox's load to the cow (Take responsibility).
Don't try to be the fastest (Don't compete).
Don't act with a twist (Don't scheme for personal benefit).
Don't turn gods into demons (Don't use slogans to increase self-absorption).
Don't seek others' pain as the limbs of your own happiness.
All activities should be done with one intention.
Correct all wrongs with one intention (or: Counter all adversity with a single remedy).
Two tasks: one at the beginning and one at the end.
Whichever of the two occurs, be patient.
Observe these two, even at the risk of your life.
Train in the three difficulties.
Take on the three principal causes (Teacher, Dharma, Sangha).
Pay heed that the three never wane (Gratitude, Appreciation of Dharma, Correct Conduct).
Keep the three inseparable (Body, Speech, and Mind).
Train without bias in all areas.
Always meditate on whatever provokes resentment.
Don't be swayed by external circumstances.
This time, practice the main points.
Don't misinterpret.
Don't be inconsistent (Don't vacillate).
Train wholeheartedly.
Liberate yourself by examining and analyzing.
Don't wallow in self-pity.
Don't be jealous.
Don't be frivolous.
Don't seek acknowledgement (Don't expect applause).
